bibl.title: Biennial Report of the State Treasurer of Nebraska to the Governor

body.seg: BIENNIAL REPORT of the STATE TREASURER Nebraska to the Governor j/'"'2E33iN. L. B. JOHNSON State Treasurer JULY 1, 1940 to JUNE 30, 1942
* I State Treasurer

STATE TREASURER 3 I REPORT OF THE STATE TREASURER State of Nebraska ; : Treasury Department ¦ . : . '•¦ ;' ' ¦.: •¦ : Lincoln July 1, 1940 To His Excellency, Bwight Griswold, Governor of Nebraska, . - . . Lincoln, Nebraska. I In compliance with the requirement of the Statutes of Nebraska, I have the honor to submit herewith the Biennial Report of the office of Treasurer of the State of Nebraska for the period beginning July 1, 1940 and ending June 30, 1942, showing all receipts, disbursements, and Investments, with the balances in the various funds on June 30, 1942. The summary is as follows: ' . Cash' on Hand July 1, 1940_. i ___™$ 7,092,745.18 Total Cash Receipts-™,.---™..™-—.-—.....— .'. 84,562,354.70 ¦:.'¦.. 1 ;..<-. ;;, ¦ I" : ;..;.;' 191,655,099.88 Total Cash Disbursements-.—..—.-..—.-.. u_. ™ 8^,397,164.23 Cash; on Hand June 30, 1942. ...,..;;-......;.....;.........,,5: 8,257,935.65 '.. - ;.}¦ ' .. ¦ '' ¦ * , ' V--- i: -..:¦¦¦ ¦ . . ¦ ¦ ".,¦- - ¦¦¦¦¦ ¦•'::: ¦'¦'¦¦ . '¦"¦'• *¦*.#.' ¦ ¦"•'."; : .'¦.¦¦.,'*Perman'ent Trust Funds Invested (Bonds) Amount Invested July 1, 1940. !— —..—™_?13,785,366.35 Investments ._-.—_.-._„.._..-.—_._ 3,464,540.17 : :";:.'¦-."¦": $17,249,906.52 Redemptions „.... .—,-„„— -...;....,.., —™_^_ 2,980,885.57 Amount Invested June 30, 1942....: — ..$14,269,020.95 Total Cash and Bonds June 30; 1942 , ..—.522,526,956.60 ¦¦•'¦¦...¦¦ . Yours respectfully, . ' ¦¦„':". ¦¦;::;;¦:' ¦'¦ y' ¦";/'¦;¦ v-H l. b. johnson. Treasurer of State. *These funds are invested by the Board of Educational Lands and Funds.

REPORT OF GENERAL STATEMENT It is with considerable pride and self satisfaction that I present this biennial report of the Treasury Department of the State of Nebraska in accordance with the Constitution and Laws of the State of Nebraska. Among the results and happenings of this biennium there are a few to which I desire to call your particuar attention. At the beginning of the biennium the General Fund showed a balance on hand of $18,401.99 and at the close of the biennium it showed a balance on hand of $1,542,663.00 which is an increase of $1,524,261.01. This is due to the increased tax collections all over the State and by a marked decrease in expenditures from this fund. During the previous biennium the expenditures from the General fund were 112,428,427.71 while during this biennium they were only $11,430,681.69 which is a decrease of $997,736.02. One new account was established during this biennium, that of the Gas Tax Agricultural Refunds in accordance with L. B. 470 passed by the last Legislature. The following accounts were terminated during this biennium: Normal Building Fund Federal Building Fund Federal Normal Building Fund AUDITS fnder the direction and supervision of the State Auditor of Public Accounts, three complete audits have been made of this office. These audits are thoroughly and efficiently performed and each of them show that all monies paid into the treasury have been properly accounted lor and that the records of this office are properly and adequately kept. BONDS At the present time all of the employees of the State Treasurer are bonded. Inasmuch as these employees receive only nominal compensation I feel that the laws should be amended, "to pay the premium on these bonds in the same manner in which the bonds of the State Treasurer and the Deputy State Treasurer are provided for." Further safeguarding of the funds was furnished through the facilities of the State Sheriff's office by providing protection for the daily deposits to the banks. I desire to herein express my personal appreciation for this service to Sheriff Lloyd Mengel and his deputies Mr. Harold Hullfish and Mr. Leonard Clark for the capable and courteous manner in which they have performed this service.

. STATE TREASURER / OUTSTANDING WARRANTS During this biennium we have balanced and placed on the monthly statement a column showing the unpaid warrants outstanding against each of the various funds. As far as I am able to ascertain this is the first time-.that the statement as published by the State Treasurer has reflected the actual balances available for use in each of the funds, in establishing this record we had the complete cooperation, of the office of the Auditor of Public Accounts and I desire to express my personal thanks to them and especially to Lucille Rudder and Katherine Schultz for the service they rendered. : . . It is my opinion that a law should be enacted limiting the time that a State Warrant could be held before presentation for payment. After a certain specified time after the date of issuance a warrant could become prima facie evidence of the indebtedness to be presented to the Legisla - ture for payment. This would simplify the keeping of records and enable the State Treasurer's office and the State Auditor of Public Account's office to be in reconcilement of the outstanding unpaid warrants at all times. ' ''; .:.- ¦¦':,..:.'. ' v. " ; •-;¦;.¦¦ :.: ¦" v .' ¦.. ¦ DEPOSITED WARRANTS We have established a system of handling State Warrants received by this office with remittances whereby they are cleared here without burdening the banks with a deposit and cancellation of them. This facili - tates the handling of these warrants and completes their handling the same day they are received. .'¦;.'¦ - -.?¦:¦:}¦;.. ¦¦.'••.V::':'' VJ:. :;V.-p» CONCLUSION /: -, ;. V /¦_'¦ We have endeavored to make it as .easy "as .possible for the other departments i to do business with this office and I wish to thank all of the State officers and all departments for the splendid cooperation which we have received and enjoyed. • . Whatever degree of success I have attained as State Treasurer I owe in a great part to the faithful employees who have been associated with me during this term and with them I share all credit with my sin - cere thanks for their loyalty and faithful performance of their duties. ¦•'¦¦¦¦;¦ ... i Respectfully submitted, ' ' L.B.JOHNSON; ¦¦; . : ,'. • ¦-.•¦¦.¦¦¦¦¦¦¦'.;V: •' '¦¦ - ' '. State Treasurer
